issues.description: In the problem statement text describing the PersonController, the methods are said to take a Consumer<List<Note>> parameter, but both the template and intended design use Consumer<List<Person>>. This mismatches the generic type in the method signature and may confuse students about which type to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> for the PersonController methods instead of Consumer<List<Note>>.

issues.description: The template’s PersonService defines instance methods (e.g. public Person savePerson(Person)), but the solution replaces these with static methods and an internal singleton, and even calls PersonService.savePerson(...) statically in PersonResource. This breaks the dependency‐injection pattern and conflicts with the injected personService field in the template.
issues.suggested_fix: Maintain the instance methods in PersonService (remove the static/singleton overhaul) and call personService.savePerson(person) on the injected instance in PersonResource to preserve dependency injection.
